snippet: Affirmative action is complicated for Asian-Americans, the U.S.’s fastest-growing ethnic group.
abstract: Affirmative action is complicated for Asian-Americans, the U.S.’s fastest-growing ethnic group.
lead_paragraph: On the campus of the University of Texas, Austin, “50,000 students from diverse ethnic backgrounds, three dozen undergraduates, many of them Asian-American, are examining Asian-American political identity in a course on that subject,” Ethan Bronner wrote in The New York Times.
